component.name: Card
component.description: Contained surface for grouping related content with header, body, and footer regions.

useCases: Grouping related content into a visual container
Form sections with header and action buttons
Product or feature cards in grid layouts
Settings panels with descriptions and controls

commonPatterns.name: basic-card
commonPatterns.description: Simple card with header, content, and footer
commonPatterns.composition:
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Card Title</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Brief description of the card content.</CardDescription>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>Main body content goes here.</CardContent>
  <CardFooter><Button variant="primary" size="sm">Save</Button></CardFooter>
</Card>

commonPatterns.name: card-with-action
commonPatterns.description: Card with a header action button (e.g., menu or settings)
commonPatterns.composition:
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle>Settings</CardTitle>
    <CardDescription>Manage your preferences.</CardDescription>
    <CardAction><Button variant="ghost" size="sm" iconOnly><MoreHorizontal className="size-4" /></Button></CardAction>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>Content here.</CardContent>
</Card>

commonPatterns.name: nested-card
commonPatterns.description: Card nested inside another card with automatic tone alternation

commonPatterns.name: card-with-dividers
commonPatterns.description: Card with header and footer divider borders for clear section separation
commonPatterns.composition:
<Card>
  <CardHeader divider>
    <CardTitle>Section</CardTitle>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent>Content between dividers.</CardContent>
  <CardFooter divider><Button variant="outline" size="sm">Cancel</Button></CardFooter>
</Card>

commonPatterns.name: small-card
commonPatterns.description: Compact card with reduced padding for dense layouts

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Card purely as a visual border without semantic grouping
antiPatterns.reason: Cards imply related content; using them as decorative borders adds unnecessary nesting
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a simple div with border classes

antiPatterns.scenario: Nesting cards more than 2 levels deep
antiPatterns.reason: Excessive nesting creates visual confusion and reduces readability
antiPatterns.alternative: Flatten the layout or use Accordion for progressive disclosure

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Card for full-page layout containers
antiPatterns.reason: Cards are for discrete content groups, not page-level layout
antiPatterns.alternative: Use layout primitives or section elements

tone.default: Alternates based on level: odd levels = primary (bg-card), even levels = secondary (bg-secondary)

borderTone.default: primary at level 1, subtle at deeper levels

slots.header: CardHeader with title, description, and optional action
slots.title: CardTitle for the heading text
slots.action: CardAction positioned in the top-right of the header
slots.content: CardContent for the main body area
slots.footer: CardFooter with accent background for actions or metadata

interactions.static: Card is a non-interactive container by default

responsive.mobile: Full-width; padding scales with size prop
responsive.desktop: Width determined by parent layout; internal padding follows size prop

accessibility.role: Generic div container; no implicit ARIA role
accessibility.keyboardSupport: Not keyboard-interactive; interactive children (buttons, links) are individually tabbable
accessibility.screenReader: No special announcement; title and description read as standard content
accessibility.focusManagement: No focus management on the card itself

rules: Level prop controls automatic tone alternation: level 1 = primary bg, level 2 = secondary bg
Level 1 cards have elevation shadow; deeper levels do not
CardFooter has an accent background tint for visual separation from content
CardHeader supports a data-divider attribute to add a bottom border
CardFooter supports a data-divider attribute to add a top border
Size auto-selects to sm for nested cards (level > 1); override with explicit size prop
CardAction is positioned in the grid's second column, spanning both title and description rows

aiHints.context: Use as the primary container for grouping related content. Level prop enables nested card alternation for visual hierarchy. Use size='sm' for compact dashboard widgets. Pair with Button in CardFooter for actionable cards. For collapsible content, consider Accordion inside a Card.
